title: Prokofiev: Romeo and Juliet - RCO, Myung-Whun Chung (1994)
description:
SERGE PROKOFIEV (1891-1953)
Romeo and Juliet
Excerpts from Suites no. 1 (op. 64a), no. 2 (op. 64b) and no. 3 (op. 101)

Amazon Editorial Review:
"Rather than play any single complete suite (of the three) that Prokofiev extracted from the complete ballet, Myung-Whun Chung makes his own selection of numbers, roughly following the plot line and including music representative of all the major characters. Although some other collections offer more music, this hour of Romeo and Juliet makes a satisfying presentation on its own. What makes the performance special is the spectacular playing of the Dutch orchestra. Frankly, it's never been done better. From the whiplash virtuosity of the violins to the bite of the trombones and the firm thud of the bass drum, this is the sound the composer must have dreamed of." --David Hurwitz

01. The Montagues and the Capulets (op. 64b:1)
02. Juliet the young girl (op. 64b:2)
03. Folk dance (op. 64a:1)
04. Scene (op. 64a:2)
05. Madrigal (op. 64a:3)
06. Minuet (op. 64a:4)
07. Masks (op. 64a:5)
08. Romeo and Juliet (op. 64a:6)
09. Tybalt's death (op. 64a:7)
10. Friar Laurence (op. 64b:3)
11. Dance (op. 64b:4)
12. Romeo and Juliet before parting (op. 64b:5)
13. Dance of the girls from the Antilles [the girls with lilies] (op. 64b:6)
14. Romeo at Juliet's tomb (op. 64b:7)
15. Death of Juliet (op. 101:6)
Total Time: 63:22

Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra
Myung-Whun Chung

Recording: Amsterdam, Het Concertgebouw, 1 & 2/1993
Executive producer: Roger Wright
Recording producer: Lennart Dehn
Balance engineer: Wolfgang Mitlehner
Recording engineer & editing: Reinhard Lagemann
